histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAlwaysShowA11yMenu
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Accessibility Menu is set to be shown regardless of the state of a11y features.(checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosHighContrast
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS High Constrast mode feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosLargeCursor
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Large Cursor feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosScreenMagnifier
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Screen Magnifier feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSpokenFeedback
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Spoken Feedback feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosVirtualKeyboard
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Virtual Keyboard feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.InvertedColors
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that high-contrast mode is enabled and the user has selected a light-on-dark color scheme (checked once 45 secs after startup). This causes Chrome to prompt the user with a bubble to optionally install a High Contrast extension and theme.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ManuallyEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome has enabled accessibility support because the user passed the --force-renderer-accessibility flag on the command-line (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.State
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome has enabled accessibility support because it detects supported assistive technology running, or due to being manually enabled via a command-line flag (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinAudioDescription
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that audio descriptions are enabled (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinJAWS
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party JAWS screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinNVDA
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party NVDA screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinSAToGo
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party System Access To Go screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinScreenReader
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that a screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup). Note that this does not necessarily mean that Chrome has detected a supported screen reader and has enabled its accessibility mode.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinStickyKeys
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that Sticky Keys are enabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinZoomText
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party ZoomText screen magnifier is running.

histogram.name: Apps.AppLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of times v2 packaged apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::AppLaunchBuckets. See also Extensions.AppLaunch.

histogram.name: Apps.AppLauncherPromo
histogram.summary: Interactions with the App Launcher promo dialog.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchCommenced
histogram.summary: The number of searches that are started in the app list. This is gathered each time the app list search box transitions from empty to non-empty.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultOpenType
histogram.summary: The type of app list search result that was opened by the user. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Ash.ActiveTouchPoints
histogram.summary: Number of active touch-points when a new touch-point is added.

histogram.name: Ash.GestureCreated
histogram.summary: The gesture-events recognized and dispatched by the browser gesture recognizer.

histogram.name: Ash.GestureTarget
histogram.summary: The gesture-events recognized and dispatched by the browser gesture recognizer for various UI components.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveInterval
histogram.summary: The interval between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveSteps
histogram.summary: The distance between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchPositionX
histogram.summary: The position of the touch-events along the X axis.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchPositionY
histogram.summary: The position of the touch-events along the Y axis.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchRadius
histogram.summary: The radius of a touch event.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartAfterEnd
histogram.summary: The interval between the end of a touch-sequence and the start of the next touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartBurst
histogram.summary: The number of rapid touch-starts that happened within a short interval. Logged once for each such burst group.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.AttemptCountFail
histogram.summary: Count of DnsAttempts before DnsTransaction completes with failure.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.AttemptCountSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of DnsAttempts before DnsTransaction completes successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigChange
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnConfigChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigNotifyInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParsePosix
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServicePosix.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseResult
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfig was parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseWin
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DNSChangerDetected
histogram.summary: Whether the first valid DnsConfig included a rogue nameserver.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DnsClientDisabledReason
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent ProcTask succeeded, at the end of a streak of failures after which the DnsClient was disabled.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DnsClientEnabled
histogram.summary: TRUE counts the events when a valid DnsConfig is received and used to enable DnsClient, while FALSE counts the events when DnsClient is disabled after a series of successful fallbacks from DnsTask to ProcTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.FallbackFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent by ProcTask in failing fallback resolutions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.FallbackSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent by ProcTask in successful fallback resolutions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HaveDnsConfig
histogram.summary: Whether there was a valid DNS configuration at the start of a job which eventually completed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostParseResult
histogram.summary: Whether DnsHosts were parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsChange
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnHostsChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsNotifyInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseWin
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsHosts in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsSize
histogram.summary: The size of the HOSTS file observed before each attempt to parse it.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_HIGHEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_IDLE
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_LOW
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_LOWEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_MEDIUM
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_HIGHEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_IDLE
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOW
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOWEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_MEDIUM
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ParseToAddressList
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing addresses out of DNS responses in successful DnsTransactions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveError
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent ProcTask succeeded.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask in resolutions that failed. Excludes time spent in the subsequent fallback.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveStatus
histogram.summary: Counts of the overall results of using asynchronous DNS in HostResolverImpl. This only includes jobs started with valid DNS configuration and excludes synchronous resolutions (as IP literals, from cache, and from HOSTS).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask in resolutions that succeeded.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerCount
histogram.summary: Count of servers in DnsConfig. Recorded on every new DnsSession, which is created on DNS change.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailureIndex
histogram.summary: Index in DnsConfig of the failing server, recorded at the time of failure.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresAfterNetworkChange
histogram.summary: Count of server failures after network change before first success in the DnsSession. Recorded at the time of first success.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresAfterSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures after success until the end of the session. Server has reported success at some point during the session. Recorded at the end of the DnsSession.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures before success. This is NOT the first success in the DnsSession. Recorded at the time of success.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresWithoutSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures without success until the end of the session. Server has never reported success during the DnsSession. Recorded at the end of the DnsSession.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerIsGood
histogram.summary: The current server is "good" and does not have to be skipped.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SortFailure
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in failing calls to AddressSorter in dual-stack resolutions using DnsTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SortSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in successful calls to AddressSorter in dual-stack resolutions using DnsTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchDone
histogram.summary: The number of names from the search name list consumed during a successful transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchRemain
histogram.summary: The number of names left on the search name list at the end of a successful transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchStart
histogram.summary: The number of names on the search name list at the start of a transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TCPAttemptFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTCPAttempt in failed attempts. Excludes timeouts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TCPAttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTCPAttempt in successful attempts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorHistogram
histogram.summary: Difference between RTT and timeout calculated using Histogram algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorHistogramUnder
histogram.summary: Difference between timeout calculated using Histogram algorithm and RTT.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorJacobson
histogram.summary: Difference between RTT and timeout calculated using Jacobson algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorJacobsonUnder
histogram.summary: Difference between timeout calculated using Jacobson algorithm and RTT.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutSpentHistogram
histogram.summary: Duration of time that would be spent waiting for lost request using Histogram algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutSpentJacobson
histogram.summary: Duration of time that would be spent waiting for lost request using Jacobson algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Excludes speculative requests.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TotalTime_speculative
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Speculative requests only.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionFailure
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in failing DnsTransactions. This includes server failures, timeouts and NXDOMAIN results.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in successful DnsTransactions. This includes all NOERROR answers, even if they indicate the name has no addresses or they cannot be parsed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess_A
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess but limited to A query type.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess_AAAA
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess but limited to AAAA query type.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TTL
histogram.summary: TTL of the resolved addresses, as in the response received from the server. For results served from local cache, the TTL is from the original response.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UDPAttemptFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsUDPAttempt in failed attempts. Excludes timeouts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UDPAttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsUDPAttempt in successful attempts. Includes responses arriving after timeout, if multiple attempts are allowed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedConfigInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time since the last empty config result to the time a non-change OnConfigChange is received.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedHostsInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time since the last empty config result to the time a non-change OnHostsChange is received.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.WatchStatus
histogram.summary: The result of DnsConfigService watch. Counts STARTED on every initialization and FAILED_* on any failure.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.Bubble
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of user interactions with the Autocheckout bubble, which prompts users to invoke Autocheckout on supported websites.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.BuyFlow
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of final states reached in Autocheckout buy flow.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.DismissalState
histogram.summary: The state of the Autocheckout dialog when it was dismissed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow, or filling process, concluded.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration.Failed
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow concluded, in cases where the flow failed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration.Succeeded
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow concluded, in cases where the flow succeeded.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.InitialUserState
histogram.summary: The initial state of a user that's interacting with a freshly shown Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.PopupInDialog
histogram.summary: User interactions with the Autofill popup shown while filling an Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.Security
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of security warnings and errors in the Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration.Cancel
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up canceling out of the dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration.Submit
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up accepting the dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiEvents
histogram.summary: Measures how users are interacting with the Autocheckout dialog UI.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiLatencyToShow
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of time it takes for the Autocheckout UI to be actionable by the user after it is shown.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WalletErrors
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of errors in communicating with the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WalletRequiredActions
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of required user actions returned by the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration.Failed
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file in case the download was failed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration.Succeeded
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file in case the download was succeeded.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of address suggestions shown in the Autofill popup.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarAccepted
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was accepted.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarDenied
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was denied.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card info bar prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.DeveloperEngagement
histogram.summary: Measures the adoption of the HTML autocomplete type hint specification (see http://is.gd/whatwg_autocomplete for more details). For each fillable form detected, logs whether that form includes author-specified type hints.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches.

histogram.name: AutoFill.ProfileCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.StoredProfileCount.
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill address profiles a user has.

histogram.name: AutoFill.Quality
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.Quality.
histogram.summary: The quality of the AutoFill implementation.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill implementation.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.HeuristicType
histogram.summary: The quality of Autofill's heuristic field type detection.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.HeuristicType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The quality of Autofill's heuristic field type detection, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.PredictedType
histogram.summary: The overall quality of the Autofill field type predictions.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.PredictedType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The overall quality of the Autofill field type predictions, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.ServerType
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill server's field type detection.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.ServerType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill server's field type detection, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: AutoFill.RequestErrorimcklfaapmppdhilegjoahjbahdgfhcn
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: AutoFill.RequestSuccessimcklfaapmppdhilegjoahjbahdgfhcn
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2011, replaced by Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Query.
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received in response to an Autofill server query.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Query
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received in response to an Autofill server query.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Upload
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received at the time of an Autofill upload.

histogram.name: AutoFill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.ServerQueryResponse.
histogram.summary: The usefulness of AutoFill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.summary: The usefulness of Autofill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCount
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill addresses a user has stored, measured at launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.UserHappiness
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of various events in the Autofill user interaction flow. By comparing frequencies, we can compute several interesting "user happiness" metrics.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ConnectedDeviceCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of simulataneously connected Bluetooth devices. Used to direct testing efforts, and by our UI team to determine appropriate UI sizes.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingMethod
histogram.summary: Records the method used to pair each Bluetooth Device. Used to direct our testing efforts.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of pairing each Bluetooth Device. Used to understand whether we are having significant problems with Bluetooth pairing and seeing errors more commonly than we should.

histogram.name: Canvas.ContextType
histogram.summary: Records the context type names used to create canvas rendering contexts.

histogram.name: Cellular.ActivationFailure
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device activation failures (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ActivationTry
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device activation tries (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ConnectionFailed
histogram.summary: The count of cellular reconnect failures during activation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ConnectionRetry
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device reconnect tries during activation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupFailed
histogram.summary: The count of successful cellular plan established (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupStart
histogram.summary: The count of initiated cellular device setup starts (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupSucceeded
histogram.summary: The count of failed cellular plan setup tries (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.PaymentFailed
histogram.summary: The count of failed cellular plan purchases (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.PaymentReceived
histogram.summary: The count of successfully completed cellular plan purchases (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: CertificateType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013. This histogram only considered the leaf certificate expiry date as a proxy for whether a certificate was in-scope for the BRs, but did not consider the issuance date. As some CAs have issued long-lived certs prior to the BRs, this disproportionately reported those certs as being subject to the BRs, but non-compliant, when in reality they're not subject.
histogram.summary: Information about the certificate algorithms and sizes in use on the web, to examine compliance with the CA/Browser Forum requirements and security best practice.

histogram.name: CertificateType2
histogram.summary: Information about the certificate algorithms and sizes in use on the web, to examine compliance with the CA/Browser Forum requirements and security best practice. This histogram considers the notBefore as the issuance date, for purposes of what requirements apply.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExempt
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user not in the search engine dialog experiment.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperiment
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in the search engine dialog experiment.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperimentSlot1
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in slot 1 of a randomized search engine dialog.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperimentSlot2
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in slot 2 of a randomized search engine dialog.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperimentSlot3
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in slot 3 of a randomized search engine dialog.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperimentSlot4
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in slot 4 of a randomized search engine dialog.

histogram.name: clickjacking.discard_download
histogram.summary: The length of time between a dangerous download appearing on the downloads shelf, and the "Discard" button being clicked.

histogram.name: clickjacking.launch_url
histogram.summary: The length of time between the external protocol dialog being shown and the "Launch Application" button being clicked.

histogram.name: clickjacking.open_download
histogram.summary: The length of time between a download appearing on the download shelf, and the user opening it by clicking the item or pressing return.

histogram.name: clickjacking.report_and_discard_download
histogram.summary: Time between "Report and Discard" button being shown and it being clicked.

histogram.name: clickjacking.save_download
histogram.summary: The length of time between a dangerous download appearing on the download shelf, and the "Keep" button being clicked.

histogram.name: Clipboard.IncognitoUseCase
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 4/2013, experiment confirmed correctness of our patch.
histogram.summary: Counts how often the user writes or reads from the clipboard and whether the write was from an incognito window or not.

histogram.name: Cookie.ParsedCookieStatus
histogram.summary: When parsing a cookie, indicates if control characters were present in any of the cookie values and if any of the cookie values were invalid. Specifically, checks that all of the parsed values are valid according to the valid token definition in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.ReinstatedCookies
histogram.summary: The duration in seconds between a cookie getting evicted (due to the number of cookies exceeding a domain limit), and subsequently reinstated.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetAttributePairCharsValidity
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie attribute pair was set with both a valid key and a valid attribute value or not. For the key, this implies that it was a valid token as defined in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters. For the value, this implies that it contained no control characters and no semicolon.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetNameValidity
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie name was set with a valid token. A valid token is defined in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetValueCookieValueValidity
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie value was valid or invalid when there was an attempt to set it, where a valid value is defined in RFC 6265 as ASCII characters excluding controls, whitspace, comma, semicolon, and backslash.

histogram.name: Cros.ClickOnShelf
histogram.summary: Chrome OS shelf clicks.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.ArchiveType
histogram.summary: The type of archive file that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.DeviceMediaType
histogram.summary: The media type of removable device that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.FilesystemType
histogram.summary: The type of file system that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: DisabledExtension.ExtensionWipedStatus
histogram.summary: Whether an extension has been wiped out.

histogram.name: DisabledExtension.SideloadWipeoutCount
histogram.summary: How many external extensions get wiped out as a result of the Sideload Wipeout one-time initiative.

histogram.name: DisabledExtension.SideloadWipeoutNeeded
histogram.summary: Whether any extension got wiped out as a result of the Sideload Wipeout one-time initiative.

histogram.name: DisabledExtension.UserSelection
histogram.summary: The user selection in the Sideload Wipeout bubble, grouped by the UmaWipeoutHistogramOptions enum.

histogram.name: DiskCache.TotalIOTime
histogram.summary: The total time it takes to perform a payload IO operation, for the regular disk cache.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptCancelled
histogram.summary: The attempt which completed after the job was already cancelled.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptDiscarded
histogram.summary: The attempt which completed after the job was already cancelled OR the attempt that has finished after host resolution was already completed by an earlier attempt.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFailDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions for actual navigations. These attempts which completed after the job was already canceled OR after the job was already completed by an earlier attempt. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFailure
histogram.summary: The attempt that has not resolved the host successfully.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFirstFailure
histogram.summary: The attempt that resolved the host first and the resolution was not successful.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFirstSuccess
histogram.summary: The attempt that resolved the host first and the resolution was successful.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: The attempt that has resolved the host successfully.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptSuccessDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions that succeeded and were requested for actual navigations. These attempts which completed after the job was already canceled OR after the job was already completed by an earlier attempt. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptTimeSavedByRetry
histogram.summary: This histogram shows the time saved by having spawned an extra attempt, when the first attempt didn't finish before retry attempt.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheEvicted
histogram.summary: The time left to expiration of an entry when it is removed while compacting the HostCache.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheExpired
histogram.summary: The time since expiration of an entry when it is removed while compacting the HostCache.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheExpiredOnGet
histogram.summary: The time since expiration of an entry when it is removed on lookup.

histogram.name: DNS.EmptyAddressListAndNoError
histogram.summary: Error status when an empty address list was found in OnLookupComplete().

histogram.name: DNS.IndependentFailedNavigation
histogram.summary: When either a pre-resolution was not done recently enough to provide benefit, or the the corresponding pre-resolution is still pending, this histogram shows the duration of time used to resolve a hostname as not existing during a failed attempt to navigate to (GET) a URL. In newer versions, if the hostname has never been found as a link during a page scan, and it has a referring URL, then it is added to referrer list data structure (hoping we'll do better next time).

histogram.name: DNS.IndependentNavigation
histogram.summary: When either a pre-resolution was not done recently enough to provide benefit, or the the corresponding pre-resolution is still pending, this histogram shows the duration of the duration of time used to resolve a hostname to navigate to (GET) a URL. In newer versions, if the hostname has never been found as a link during a page scan, and it has a referring URL, then it is added to referrer list data structure (hoping we'll do better next time).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_HIGHEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_IDLE
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_LOW
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_LOWEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_MEDIUM
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_HIGHEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_IDLE
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOW
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOWEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_MEDIUM
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchCacheEviction
histogram.summary: The duration of time used (most recently) to pre-resolve a hostname, when the prefetched resolution was apparently evicted from the cache. The included samples only list pre-resolution times when the later navigations/fetches took in excess of 15ms.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchCacheEvictionL
histogram.summary: The duration of time used (most recently) to pre-resolve a hostname, when the prefetched resolution was apparently evicted from the cache. The included samples only list pre-resolution times when the later navigations/fetches took in excess of 15ms.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchFoundName
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchFoundNameL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchFoundNameL
histogram.summary: The duration of time used by the DNS pre-resolving threads to resolve a host name via the network. Any resolutions that are faster than 15ms are considered to be local cache hits, not requiring network access, and are not included in this histogram. This histogram is most useful for estimating the typical cost of a name resolution, but it also estimates the total number of network-based resolutions induced by this feature. Not all these resolutions prove helpful (i.e., the user does not always actually visit the resolved hostnames).

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchNegativeHit
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchNegativeHitL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchNegativeHitL
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name not found" case. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache. For some users with LANs, all negative results (even when the DNS cache might otherwise help) take about 2.5 seconds (due to timeouts for netbios broadcasts), and hence no savings are possible (or shown) for such users in this category.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchPositiveHit
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchPositiveHitL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchPositiveHitL
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name was found" case, and induced by either a page scan for a link or an omnibox entry by the user. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchQueue
histogram.summary: The duration of time spent by a proposed resolution waiting in the queue to be resolved. This number is in addition to any DNS resolution time that may come later.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchReferredPositiveHit
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name was found" case, and induced by predicting (using referrer lists) that a resolution was needed. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchResolution
histogram.summary: The duration of time used by the DNS pre-resolving threads to resolve a host name via the network. Any resolutions that are faster than 15ms are considered to be local cache hits, not requiring network access, and are not included in this histogram. This histogram is most useful for estimating the typical cost of a name resolution, but it also estimates the total number of network-based resolutions induced by this feature. Not all these resolutions prove helpful (i.e., the user does not always actually visit the resolved hostnames).

histogram.name: DNS.QueueRecycledDeltaOver2
histogram.summary: When, due to congestion avoidance, a queued pre-resolution is abandoned (recycled) without actually being resolved, this histograms records the age in the queue of that entry. Only times over 2 seconds are recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: DNS.QueueRecycledUnder2
histogram.summary: When, due to congestion avoidance, a queued pre-resolution is abandoned (recycled) without actually being resolved, this histograms records the age in the queue of that entry. Only times less than or equal to 2 seconds are recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveCategory
histogram.summary: Counts of successes and failures of OS resolutions in various categories.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions for actual navigations. Note that cached OS resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSpeculativeFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in speculative OS resolutions. Note that cached OS resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSpeculativeSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in speculative OS resolution that succeeded. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess
DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveUnspecWaste
histogram.summary: Counts of hits and misses in the DNS cache and DNS jobs pool of wasted HostResolverImpl::Jobs that could be avoided by always resolving using AF_UNSPEC.

histogram.name: DNS.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Excludes speculative requests.

histogram.name: DNS.TotalTime_speculative
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Speculative requests only.

histogram.name: DNS.UnexpectedResolution
histogram.summary: In some cases, such as when content arrives with embedded references to other servers, the prefetch system can't (or doesn't) attempt to pre-resolve the hostnames. As an example, a visit to www.cnn.com will fetch content with references to about 12 additional hostnames, none of which are currently anticipated. Such resolutions are termed "Unexpected Resolutions," and the durations associated with those DNS resolutions are shown below. Future features may attempt to learn (from prior experience locally, or from server provided hints), what secondary hostname resolutions should be done when a primary resolution (or navigation) takes place. This histogram shows what the potential savings are that "remain on the table" until we employ some of these more advanced features.

histogram.name: DNS.UnexpectedResolutionL
histogram.summary: In some cases, such as when content arrives with embedded references to other servers, or when a page (such as one in SSL) preclude scanning and prefetching, the prefetch system can't (or doesn't) attempt to pre-resolve the hostnames. As an example, a visit to www.cnn.com will fetch content with references to about 12 additional hostnames, none of which might be anticipated. Similarly, clicking on a link in an SSL page won't be anticipated (since scanning in not allowed by default). Such resolutions are termed "Unexpected Resolutions," and the durations associated with those navigation induced DNS resolutions are shown below. If a referring URL is available for the navigation, the relationship to the referring URL was recorded, and future navigations to the referring hostname would have induced a pre-resolution of hostname that caused an entry below. Such any entry may facilitate future listing in the ReferredPositiveHit histogram.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.ErrorPageUpdateStatus
histogram.summary: Status of DNS probe updates sent to a DNS error page.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Time between starting and finishing DNS probe.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.NcnOffline.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Time between starting and finishing DNS probe when NCN says we're offline.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.NcnOffline.Result
histogram.summary: Result of DNS probes sent by the probe service when NCN says we're offline.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.NcnOnline.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Time between starting and finishing DNS probe when NCN says we're online.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.NcnOnline.Result
histogram.summary: Result of DNS probes sent by the probe service when NCN says we're online.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.Result
histogram.obsolete: Renamed 7/2013 to DnsProbe.ProbeResult. (Also switched to the full DnsProbe.ProbeStatus enum.)
histogram.summary: Result of DNS probes sent by the probe service.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.ResultBadConfig.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of DNS probes that return PROBE_BAD_CONFIG.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.ResultBadConfig.SystemIsLocalhost
histogram.summary: Whether the only nameserver in the system DNS config was 127.0.0.1 when the probe result was BAD_CONFIG.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.ResultBadConfig.SystemJobResult
histogram.summary: The result of the system probe job when the overall probe result was BAD_CONFIG.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.ResultBadConfig.SystemNameserverCount
histogram.summary: The number of nameservers in the system DNS config when the probe result was BAD_CONFIG.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.ResultNoInternet.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of DNS probes that return PROBE_NO_INTERNET.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.ResultNxdomain.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of DNS probes that return PROBE_NXDOMAIN.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.ResultUnknown.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of DNS probes that return PROBE_UNKNOWN.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.ProbeDuration
histogram.summary: Time between starting and finishing DNS probe.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.ProbeResult
histogram.summary: Result of DNS probes sent by the probe service.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadedCount
histogram.summary: Number of certs loaded from domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent loading domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, on disk, of the domain bound cert database as it is being loaded.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GenerateCertTime
histogram.summary: Time spent generating a domain bound cert.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTime
histogram.summary: Combined time for GetDomainBoundCert retrieval (both synchronous and asynchronous).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTimeAsync
histogram.summary: Time for asynchronous retrieval (from the GetDomainBoundCert call until completion callback is called).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTimeSync
histogram.summary: Time for synchronous GetDomainBoundCert cert retrieval.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetDomainBoundCertResult
histogram.summary: Result of GetDomainBoundCert function.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.KillDatabaseResult
histogram.summary: Whether the domain-bound certs sqlite database was killed succesfully when an unrecoverable error was detected.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.Support
histogram.summary: Counts of SSL client sockets broken down by support for Domain Bound Certificates TLS extension. Counts only connections with full handshakes, resumed sessions are not counted.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.TaskMaxWaitTime
histogram.summary: Longest time spent by requests waiting for load of domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.TaskWaitCount
histogram.summary: Number of requests that waited for load of domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesBytes.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that accept byte ranges.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesMissingOrInvalid.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that do not specify whether the accept ranges, or have invalid ranges specified.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesNone.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that do not accept ranges.

histogram.name: Download.ActualBandwidth
histogram.summary: The actual bandwidth (per read) of a download.

histogram.name: Download.ApiFunctions
histogram.summary: Downloads extension API function calls.

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthDiskBytesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Disk bandwidth (defined as total bytes divided by the amount of time blocked on write or close on the file descriptor) seen for a single download.

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthOverallBytesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Overall bandwidth seen for the download. Note that this is measured at the point at which the file is written, and so will not take into account the time costs of activities that occur after file write is completed (e.g. safe browsing scanning).

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthUsed
histogram.summary: The percentage of the potential bandwidth actually used (per read) of a download. An entry of 100% implies that Chrome was the limiting factor in download speed.

histogram.name: Download.ClearAllSize
histogram.summary: The number of downloads in history at the time it is cleared.

histogram.name: Download.ContentDisposition
histogram.summary: Content-Disposition header features. The presence of a Content-Disposition header, use of 'name', 'filename' and 'filename*' parameters, and string encoding schemes are counted for each unthrottled download. The total number downloads is Download.Counts[5] (Initiated and Unthrottled).

histogram.name: Download.ContentImageType
histogram.summary: Types of images that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.ContentType
histogram.summary: Content types that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.Counts
histogram.summary: Various individual counts in the download system; see DownloadCountType for details.

histogram.name: Download.CountsChrome
histogram.summary: Various individual counts in the download system, for example the number of downloads blocked by throttling from the DownloadRequestLimiter.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousDownloadValidated
histogram.summary: User chose to save a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRecordDropped
histogram.summary: Reason for dropping a record read in from the DB.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsCount
histogram.summary: Number of downloads removed from the history at once.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsTime
histogram.summary: How long it took to delete some downloads from history.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsTimePerRecord
histogram.summary: How long it took to delete some downloads from history, per download.

histogram.name: Download.Discard
histogram.summary: A download which was marked dangerous was discarded without the user directly choosing, because the browser was closed. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.DiskBandwidthUsedPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the available disk bandwidth that was used by the download. 100% indicates that the disk bandwidth was the limiting factor for the download.

histogram.name: Download.DOMEvent
histogram.summary: User actions in chrome://downloads

histogram.name: Download.DownloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of successfully completed downloads.

histogram.name: Download.FilePickerResult
histogram.summary: How the user interacts with the file chooser when doing a "Save As" for non-full-page saves.

histogram.name: Download.FileThreadBlockedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time in milliseconds the file thread blocks for each set of buffers drained from the incoming pipe (ms).

histogram.name: Download.FileThreadReceiveBuffers
histogram.summary: The number of buffers in a call to DownloadManager::UpdateDownload.

histogram.name: Download.FirstOpenTime
histogram.summary: The time between a download completing and the file being opened for the first time.

histogram.name: Download.HistorySize
histogram.summary: The number of items in the History database, at the time a new download is recorded.

histogram.name: Download.HistorySize2
histogram.summary: The number of items in the History database, at the time a new download is recorded. Higher maximum, more buckets than Download.HistorySize.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedAtEndError
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused a download to be interrupted at the *end* of a download (when the number of bytes is known). This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedAtEndReason
histogram.summary: The reason that a download was interrupted at the *end* of a download (when the number of bytes is known). This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedError
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused a download to be interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedOverrunBytes
histogram.summary: The excessive number of bytes which have been received at the time that a download is interrupted. This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedReason
histogram.summary: The reason that a download was interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedReceivedSizeK
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes received for a download at the time it is interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedTotalSizeK
histogram.summary: The reported total size in kilobytes for a download at the time it is interrupted. This is essentially the size reported by the Content-Length header. If no size is specified up-front, it is not recorded in the histogram. For example, a download transferred with chunked encoding will not be recorded.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedUnderrunBytes
histogram.summary: The total number of bytes minus the received number of bytes at the time that a download is interrupted. This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedUnknownSize
histogram.summary: True if the size of an interrupted download is unknown, false if it is known.

histogram.name: Download.MapErrorNetworkFailed
histogram.summary: Network error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_NETWORK_FAILED result in DownloadResourceHandler::OnResponseCompleted().

histogram.name: Download.MapWinShErrorAccessDenied
histogram.summary: Windows error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_ACCESS_DENIED result in MapShFileOperationCodes().

histogram.name: Download.MapWinShErrorFileFailed
histogram.summary: Windows error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_FILE_FAILED result in MapShFileOperationCodes().

histogram.name: Download.OnChanged
histogram.summary: Percentage of DownloadItem::Observer::OnDownloadUpdated events that signified a change in the extension API representation of the download.

histogram.name: Download.OpensOutstanding
histogram.summary: The number of unopened downloads, when one is opened.

histogram.name: Download.OpenTime
histogram.summary: The time between a download completing and the file being opened.

histogram.name: Download.PotentialBandwidth
histogram.summary: The maximum bandwidth (per read) that Chrome could have provided for the download. If the actual bandwidth equals the potential bandwidth, that means that Chrome was the limiting factor for download bandwidth.

histogram.name: Download.ResourceHandlerBlockedPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the lifetime of the DownloadResourceHandler for which it was blocked by downstream flow control. 0% indicates that the network bandwidth was the limiting factor for the download.

histogram.name: Download.SavePackage
histogram.summary: Events (e.g. Started, Cancelled, Finished, Write to Completed file, Write to Failed file) occuring within the state machine of a SavePackage operation.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfInProgressSizeOnAutoClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items in progress on the shelf when it closes automatically.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfInProgressSizeOnUserClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items in progress on the shelf when the user closes it.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfSizeOnAutoClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items on the shelf when it closes automatically.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfSizeOnUserClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items on the shelf when the user closes it.

histogram.name: Download.Sources
histogram.summary: The initiation source (if initiated within the content layer of chrome) for a download.

histogram.name: Download.SourcesChrome
histogram.summary: The initiation source (if initiated within the above-content layer of chrome) for a download.

histogram.name: Download.Time
histogram.summary: Time between the start of a download and its completion.

histogram.name: Download.UserDiscard
histogram.summary: User chose to discard a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.WriteLoopCount
histogram.summary: The number of iterations for the write loop in BaseFile::AppendDataTofile().

histogram.name: Download.WriteSize
histogram.summary: The write size for calls to BaseFile::AppendDataTofile().

histogram.name: Drive.CacheDBOpenStatus
histogram.summary: Status of drive cache metadata database open.

histogram.name: Drive.EntireFeedLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the entire file system information from the server

histogram.name: Drive.EntryKind
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific formats for hosted documents. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: Drive.FileFormat
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific file formats for regular files. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: Drive.InitialFeedLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the initial part of the file system information from the server

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBInitResult
histogram.summary: Result of drive resource metadata database initialization.

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBOpenExistingResult
histogram.summary: Result of attempt to open existing drive resource metadata database.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfHostedDocuments
histogram.summary: Number of hosted documents (spreadsheets etc.) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfRegularFiles
histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfTotalFiles
histogram.summary: Number of total files (regualr files + hosted documents) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.PushNotificationInitiallyEnabled
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the push notification is initially enabled for Drive. Recorded when the first notification is processed. Notification is emulated by polling if the push notication is disabled.

histogram.name: Drive.PushNotificationRegistered
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the push notification request is registered correctly for Drive. Recorded when the push notification manager is initialized.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentExtraTime
histogram.summary: Time since the user logged in until the auto-enrollment protocol completed. 0 is sampled when the protocol is done by the time the user logs in.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentProtocolTime
histogram.summary: Total duration time of the auto-enrollment protocol.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestNetworkErrorCode
histogram.summary: Network error code (if applicable) for auto-enrollment requests.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestStatus
histogram.summary: URL fetcher status for auto-enrollment requests.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DMToken
histogram.summary: Events related to fetching, saving and loading DM server tokens. These are used to retrieve cloud policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Enrollment
histogram.summary: Events related to device enrollment on new installs of ChromeOS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ONC.PolicyValidation
histogram.summary: Result of the OpenNetworkConfiguration policy validation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies
histogram.summary: A set of enterprise policy rules that are in use. This is recorded every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was earlier than a day before.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policy
histogram.summary: Events related to fetching, saving and loading user policies, and also device policies on ChromeOS.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidationsStartupTime
histogram.summary: Time since startup of the cloud policy code until the policy invalidation service first reported its online status.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Load status from the policy loaders which pull policy settings from the underlying platform, such as Windows Group Policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyRefresh
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedCount.Mouse
histogram.summary: Number of Mouse events coalesced.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedCount.Touch
histogram.summary: Number of Touch events coalesced.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedLatency.Mouse
histogram.summary: Time between the first and last events in a coalesced mouse events group.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedLatency.Touch
