histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.BlacklistInstalled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were blacklisted when already installed, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService blackists and unloads an installed extension.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.BlockCRX
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that have been blocked from installing grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService refuses to install a blacklisted extension.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.SilentInstall
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that have been silently installed in a blacklisted state, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService installs a blacklisted extension without blocking it (ExtensionBlacklist.BlockCRX would be logged otherwise). Typically this will be when a user has a blacklisted extension synced.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.UnblacklistInstalled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were unblacklisted when installed, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService unblacklists and loads a blacklisted extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.AllocatePortIdPairOverflow
histogram.summary: Records when the allocation of IDs for chrome.runtime.Port overflows.

histogram.name: Extensions.APIUse_RelativeURL
histogram.summary: Captures the results of URL resolution when relative urls are used in the tabs/windows api.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of times v1 apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::AppLaunchBuckets. See also Apps.AppLaunch for v2 apps.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunchContainer
histogram.summary: The number of times apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::LaunchContainer.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLocation
histogram.summary: The number of apps loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppsPromo
histogram.summary: The actions taken in the NTP apps promo grouped by extension_misc::AppsPromoBuckets.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppTabLaunchType
histogram.summary: The number of apps launched grouped by ExtensionPrefs::LaunchType.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for an extension's background page to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageType
histogram.summary: The type (if any) of background page the extension has. Recorded for installed extensions on startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchFailureRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchFailureRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchSuccessRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchSuccessRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxInstallDirPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the path to the directory under which an extension is installed. This directory is in the user's profile.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeRulesStorageInitialization
histogram.summary: Time spent until rules storage delegate gets ready.

histogram.name: Extensions.DepricatedExternalJsonCount
histogram.summary: Number of extensions referenced in the depricated external extensions source at path chrome::DIR_DEPRICATED_EXTERNAL_EXTENSIONS.

histogram.name: Extensions.DialogLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for a dialog-hosted extension to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.Disabled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are disabled at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledForPermissions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are disabled at browser startup due to permissions increases.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponse
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to an update requiring more permissions.

histogram.name: Extensions.ErrorCodeFromCrxOpen
histogram.summary: If opening the CRX file for unpacking fails, this integer is the error code given by the OS.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageActiveTime
histogram.summary: The time an extension's event page has spent loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageIdleTime
histogram.summary: The time an extension's event page has spent unloaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for an extension's event page to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionInstalled
histogram.summary: An extension has been installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionLocation
histogram.summary: The number of extensions loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionRootPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the Extensions dir path inside the profile directory.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUninstalled
histogram.summary: An extension has been uninstalled.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalExtensionEvent
histogram.summary: Records what happens to extensions that are sideloaded, grouped by the ExternalExtensionEvent enum.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalItemState
histogram.summary: The number of sideloaded apps/extensions loaded on startup grouped by enabled/disabled state.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalJsonCount
histogram.summary: Number of extensions referenced in the external extensions source at path chrome::DIR_EXTERNAL_EXTENSIONS.

histogram.name: Extensions.FromWebstoreInconsistency
histogram.summary: Number of apps/extensions loaded on startup with an inconsistent "from webstore" state. This means an item that is flagged as from_webstore, but with either a non-webstore update_url or an external install location.

histogram.name: Extensions.FunctionCalls
histogram.summary: Number of calls to extension functions.

histogram.name: Extensions.GetUserDataTempDir
histogram.summary: What happens when the extensions system tries to get a temp dir to unpack in?

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectCssTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time for a CSS file to be injected into a page.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectEnd_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document end by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectEnd_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts at document end by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectIdle_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document idle by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectIdle_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts at document idle by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectScriptTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_CssCount
histogram.summary: Number of css files injected by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document start by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject css/scripts at document start by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallSource
histogram.summary: Installs grouped by the location property in prefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallType
histogram.summary: Installs grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAll
histogram.summary: The number of extensions and themes loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAllTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load all extensions at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadApp
histogram.summary: The number of apps loaded by each user at startup time.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAppExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed apps loaded by each user at startup time.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAppUser
histogram.summary: The number of user-installed apps loaded by each user at startup time.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadBrowserAction
histogram.summary: The number of browser action extensions loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadContentPack
histogram.summary: The number of content-pack extensions loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtension
histogram.summary: The number of extensions loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtensionExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed extensions loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtensionUser
histogram.summary: The number of user-installed extensions loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed extensions and apps loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadHostedApp
histogram.summary: The number of hosted apps loaded by each user at startup time.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadPackagedApp
histogram.summary: The number of legacy packaged apps loaded by each user at startup time.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadPageAction
histogram.summary: The number of page action extensions loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadPlatformApp
histogram.summary: The number of platform apps loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadTheme
histogram.summary: The number of themes loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadType
histogram.summary: The number of extensions loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadUserScript
histogram.summary: The number of converted user scripts loaded at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchFailureRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchFailureRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchSuccessRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchSuccessRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadNeedsRelocalization
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is necessary to reload the mainfest because the locale has changed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadNotNeeded
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is not necessary to reload the extension's manifest.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadUnpackedDir
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is necessary to reload the manifest because the extension is unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelay
histogram.summary: Time that network requests were blocked due to extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelayPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of total lifetime a network request was blocked due to an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelayRegistryLoad
histogram.summary: Time that network requests were blocked due to relevant rule registries loading.

histogram.name: Extensions.NonWebstoreLocation
histogram.summary: The number of apps/extensions with a non-webstore update_url loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.NonWebStoreNewTabPageOverrides
histogram.summary: Number of non-WebStore extensions on startup that override the new tab page.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade).

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Install
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Load
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted, not including installation errors and manual user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallAbort
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallCancel
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackFailure
histogram.summary: Count the number of times a sandboxed extension unpack fails.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackFailureReason
histogram.summary: What caused a sandboxed extension unpack to fail?

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackFailureTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to unpack an extension, when the unpack fails.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackInitialCrxPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the initial path to the CRX to be unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackLinkFreeCrxPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the normalized (link/junction free) path to the temporary copy of a CRX made during unpacking.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate
histogram.summary: Rate at which a CRX file is unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate1To2mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 1MB to 2MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate2To5mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 2MB to 5MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate50kBTo1mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 50kB to 1MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate5To10mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 5MB to 10 MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRateOver10mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files larger than 10MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRateUnder50kB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files under 50 KB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccess
histogram.summary: Count the number of times a sandboxed CRX unpack succeeds.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccessCantGetCrxSize
histogram.summary: Count the number of times a sandboxed CRX unpack succeeds, but we can't get the file size.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccessTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to unpack an extension, when the unpack succeeds.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackTempCrxPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the path of the temporary copy of a CRX made during unpacking.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackUnpackedCrxPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the path under which a CRX is unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.StartupDelay
histogram.summary: The time one extension delays network requests at startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.StartupDelay_Total
histogram.summary: The total time extensions delay network requests at startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ToolstripLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load a toolstrip.

histogram.name: Extensions.UninstallType
histogram.summary: Uninstalls grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackFailureInstallCause
histogram.summary: Count failing CRX installs, grouped by the way an extension can be installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackFailureInstallSource
histogram.summary: Count successful CRX installs, grouped by the location property in prefs. installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackSuccessInstallCause
histogram.summary: Count successful CRX installs, grouped by the cause of the install.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackSuccessInstallSource
histogram.summary: Count successful CRX installs, grouped by the location property in prefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckApp
histogram.summary: The number of legacy packaged apps and hosted apps that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckExtension
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckGap
histogram.summary: Time in minutes between update checks.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: The number of crx's with a Google-hosted update URL that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckNoUrl
histogram.summary: The number of crx's with no update URL checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckOtherUrl
histogram.summary: The number of crx's with a non-Google update URL that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckPackagedApp
histogram.summary: The number of packaged apps that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckTheme
histogram.summary: The number of themes that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateOnLoad
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were updated at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdaterWriteCrx
histogram.summary: What happened when the extension updater tried to write a file?

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateSource
histogram.summary: Updates grouped by the location property in prefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateType
histogram.summary: Updates grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Create
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser opening mode.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DirectoryScan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time to scan a directory. Measured on every File Browser directory change.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadDestination.IsGoogleDrive.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder when the download destination is changed by the user in the settings page.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadDestination.IsGoogleDrive.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder on startup.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadsCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of files and directories in the Downloads directory (not including the contents of nested directories). Computed every time the File Browser current directory changes to Downloads.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Add
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user adds a folder shortcut.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Count
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of saved folder shorcuts. This is recorded when Files.app is launched.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Navigate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user clicks or selects a folder shortcut and is navigated to the target folder.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Remove
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user removes a folder shortcut.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser is an built-in extension without a background page. Its main.html file is loaded every time the user opens a File Browser tab or a file chooser dialog. The file is fairly large and the initialization is pretty expensive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OpeningFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be opened through browser.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.DisplayTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to display an image. Measured from the moment the user selected the image till the moment it is displayed (not counting the low resolution preview).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.FileType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the type of the file opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.LoadMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the way the image has been loaded.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to load an image from a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.SaveResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the result of a file save operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.SaveTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to save an image to a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Size.MB
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: size of an image file in megabytes. Measured on every image load.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Size.MPix
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: size of an image in megapixels. Measured on every image load.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Tool
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the button which the user clicked.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Action
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: action chosen in the Action Choice dialog for the external device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the number of photos imported. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportPercentage
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the percent of photos imported among all the photos on the device. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to load the action dialog. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment user see all available actions for the device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Scan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to scan the external device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be viewed through browser. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from Files.app.

histogram.name: GData.AuthSuccess
histogram.summary: Result of the authentication for Drive.

histogram.name: GData.EntireFeedLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the entire file system information from the server

histogram.name: GData.EntryKind
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific formats for hosted documents. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: GData.InitialFeedLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the initial part of the file system information from the server

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfHostedDocuments
histogram.summary: Number of hosted documents (spreadsheets etc.) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfRegularFiles
histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfTotalFiles
histogram.summary: Number of total files (regualr files + hosted documents) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Event
histogram.summary: Events in Google Now component extension.

histogram.name: History.TopSitesVisitsByRank
histogram.summary: Page visits to each of a user's top 50 sites. Visits to all other sites go into the 51st bucket. Only count the page visit if it came from user browsing and only count it once when cycling through a redirect chain.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.ClickPosition
histogram.summary: Number of entries that the clicked entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.ClickPositionSubset
histogram.summary: Subset of the Click Position histogram. Contains only the first smaller subset of entries on the page. Number of entries that the clicked entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is entries of that value or higher.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.OtherDevicesMenu
histogram.summary: Histogram for usage of the section in the history page that allows the user to access tabs from other devices.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.RemoveEntryPosition
histogram.summary: Number of entries that the deleted entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher. Confirmed removal is not guaranteed, just an initiation of 'Remove selected items'.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.RemoveEntryPositionSubset
histogram.summary: Subset of Remove Entry Position histogram. Contains only the first smaller subset of entries on the page. Number of entries that the deleted entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher. Confirmed removal is not guaranteed, just an initiation of 'Remove selected items'.

histogram.name: HttpCache.EntryLockWait
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for write lock on a disk cache entry.

histogram.name: HttpCache.OfflineStatus
histogram.summary: Result of a main page HttpCacheTransaction if offline mode had been enabled.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ReadErrorNonRestartable
histogram.summary: Net error results from non-restartable cache read errors.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ReadErrorRestartable
histogram.summary: Net error results from restartable cache read errors.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.AutoImport
histogram.summary: The importer used on first run Auto Import.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.BookmarksAPI
histogram.summary: The importer used on import from the bookmarks file API.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.ImportDataHandler
histogram.summary: The importer used on import from the chrome://settings/importData UI.

histogram.name: Import.ShowDialog.FromBookmarkBarView
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import.ShowDialog.FromFloatingBookmarkBarView
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from NTP floating BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import_ShowDlg.FromBookmarkBarView
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import_ShowDlg.FromFloatingBookmarkBarView
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from NTP floating BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Installer.DevModeErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Errors from update_engine process when running in dev mode.

histogram.name: Installer.DownloadOverheadPercentage
histogram.summary: The overhead in downloading extra bytes due to errors/interruptions. Expressed as a percentage of the bytes that are actually needed to be downloaded for the update to be successful.

histogram.name: Installer.DownloadSourcesUsed
histogram.summary: The combinations of protocol and source server that were used to complete a successful update.

histogram.name: Installer.NormalErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Errors from update_engine process when running in normal mode.

histogram.name: Installer.SuccessfulMBsDownloadedFrom
histogram.summary: Number of MBs downloaded from during an update that completed successfully.

histogram.name: Installer.TotalMBsDownloadedFrom
histogram.summary: Total number of MBs downloaded since the last successful update. This also includes all the bytes downloaded during any prior failed attempts.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateDurationMinutes
histogram.summary: Absolute wallclock time duration it took for the update to complete from the time an update first began. It includes not just the time the device was up, but also includes the time the device spent sleeping.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateDurationUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary: Uptime duration it took for the update to complete from the time an update first began. It does not include the time the device spent sleeping, but it does include the uptime spent in waiting for the hourly update checks to happen.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateNumReboots
histogram.summary: Number of times the device was rebooted by the user since an update began and until it completed successfully.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateURLSwitches
histogram.summary: Number of times the download URLs were switched due to failures.

histogram.name: Instant.InstantControllerEvent
histogram.summary: Records various events of interest in the InstantController. E.g. When URLs are blacklisted.

histogram.name: Instant.SessionsStorageNamespace
histogram.summary: How often an Instant preview is committed onto a different tab than it was created from.

histogram.name: Instant.TimeToFirstShow
histogram.summary: The time between the first Omnibox interaction and when the Instant preview shows. If the instant preview was already showing when the user interacted with the omnibox, this histogram is not recorded.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.FallbackToLocalOverlay
histogram.summary: Records the cause for falling back to a local overlay at the time of fallback.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.InstantNavigation
histogram.summary: Records a histogram for instant extended (Local NTP and Online NTP) and non-extended navigations.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.NewOptInState
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, whether the user has chosen to opt-in to or opt-out of InstantExtended via chrome://flags.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.OptInState
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-06. As of m30 use InstantExtended.NewOptInState.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, whether the user has chosen to opt-in to or opt-out of InstantExtended via chrome://flags.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchQuerytoQuery
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to another search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchQuerytoURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to a url. Example: Accidental search for google.con, then navigation to google.com.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchURLtoQuery
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to a search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchURLtoURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to another url.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_QuerytoQuery
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to another search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_QuerytoURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to a url. Example: Accidental search for google.con, then navigation to google.com.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_URLtoQuery
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to a search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_URLtoURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to another url.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PrefValue
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-06. This preference has not been exposed or used for months, and we do not plan to use it in the future.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, the value of the "Allow your search engine to provide Instant result" preference setting for the first profile loaded.

histogram.name: interstitial.authority_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_AUTHORITY_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.common_name_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.date_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_DATE_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl
histogram.summary: User action when the user is shown a SSL interstitial. SHOW_ALL and MORE refer to the total number of SSL errors; all of the other numbers pertain to the number of actions related to SSL errors that are overridable. The counts do not sum to 100%; SHOW_ALL is a superset of SHOW_OVERRIDABLE, which in turn will be a supserset of the PROCEED/DONT_PROCEED variables. SHOW_UNDERSTAND is only being used by an experimental field trial.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_accept_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, when the user accepts the SSL warning. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_error_type
histogram.summary: The type of SSL error that the user encounters. This is recorded for all SSL warnings, regardless of whether they are overridable.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_reject_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, when the user rejects the SSL warning. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.AcceptLanguage
histogram.summary: Accept languages.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.ApplicationLanguage
histogram.summary: Application languages used for UI.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.All.SafeThreadAccess
histogram.summary: Linux and CrOS use unlocked_stdio(3). If it is used unsafely, record it here. If there is no record of unsafety after chrome 29 has been in the stable channel for a few weeks then revert this change.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Chromium environment has IO errors when being used by IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single leveldb env method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.NewLogger
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewLogger.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.NewSequentialFile
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewSequentialFile.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.RandomAccessFile
histogram.summary: File errors in leveldb IDBEnv's NewRandomAccessFile method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.WritableFileAppend
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileAppend.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.WritableFileFlush
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileFlush.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.LockFileAncestorsNotFound
histogram.summary: Number of directories missing when IDB LevelDBEnv tries to create a Lock file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.MaxFDs
histogram.summary: File descriptor limit recorded every time LevelDB calls NewRandomAccessFile for IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.RetryRecoveredFromErrorIn
histogram.summary: When IDB LevelDBEnv successfully retries an operation that had failed, record the error from the most recent failed attempt.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.TimeTo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.IDB.TimeUntilSuccessFor.
histogram.summary: Time IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.TimeUntilSuccessFor
histogram.summary: Time IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Chromium environment has IO errors.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single leveldb method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewLogger
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewLogger.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewSequentialFile
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewSequentialFile.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.RandomAccessFile
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewRandomAccessFile.
histogram.summary: File errors in leveldb ChromiumEnv's NewRandomAccessFile method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.WritableFileAppend
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileAppend.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.WritableFileFlush
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileFlush.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.LockFileAncestorsNotFound
histogram.summary: Number of directories missing when Non-IDB LevelDBEnv tries to create a Lock file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.MaxFDs
histogram.summary: File descriptor limit recorded every time LevelDB calls NewRandomAccessFile for clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.RetryRecoveredFromErrorIn
histogram.summary: When Non-IDB LevelDBEnv successfully retries an operation that had failed, record the error from the most recent failed attempt.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.TimeTo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor.
histogram.summary: Time Non-IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor
histogram.summary: Time Non-IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: Linux.GlibcVersion
histogram.summary: The version of glibc used. (Linux only)

histogram.name: Media.AcceleratedCompositingActive
histogram.summary: Whether accelerated compositing was used for HTML5 media rendering.

histogram.name: Media.AudioBitsPerChannel
histogram.summary: Bits per channel of HTML5 audio sample data.

histogram.name: Media.AudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Audio channel layout in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.AudioCodec
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputController
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for AudioInputController::

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputDeviceManager
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for AudioInputDeviceManager::

histogram.name: Media.AudioOutputController
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for AudioOutputController::

histogram.name: Media.AudioOutputControllerDataNotReady
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting in AudioOutputController::WaitTillDataReady() if the data was not initially available.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererEvents
histogram.summary: Captures statistics for various AudioRendererImpl events.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererMissedDeadline
histogram.summary: Percentage of AudioSyncReader::Read() calls where the renderer missed its realtime deadline.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSampleFormat
histogram.summary: Audio sample format in HTML5 media. Logged when Audio Decoder initializes.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Audio samples per second in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSamplesPerSecondUnexpected
histogram.summary: Audio samples per second in HTML5 media (atypical values, in Hz).

histogram.name: Media.CacheUseful
histogram.summary: Whether a media response might be used to satisfy a future request.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.DelayedAndDroppedFramesPer5Sec
histogram.summary: The average number of delayed and dropped frames for the ChromeCast application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.DisplayedFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The average number of displayed frames for the ChromeCast application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.TimeToBufferAv
histogram.summary: Time needed to pre-buffer A/V data before the actual playback for the ChromeCast application.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.TimeToBufferAvAfterAbort
histogram.summary: Time needed to buffer A/V data after an abort for the ChromeCast application.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.TimeToBufferAvAfterUnderrun
histogram.summary: Time needed to buffer A/V data after an underrun for the ChromeCast application.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedAudioCodec
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedContainer
histogram.summary: Container used for HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedVideoCodec
histogram.summary: Video codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.DevicePermissionActions
histogram.summary: Measures the actions taken in the media infobar, which prompts the users for device permission.

histogram.name: Media.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of HTML5 media (when known).

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.addKey

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.cancelKeyRequest

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.KeyError
histogram.summary: KeyError event count using the Clear Key key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.NeedKey
histogram.summary: EME NeedKey event count.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.addKey

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.cancelKeyRequest
histogram.summary: cancelKeyRequest result using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.DecryptError

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.generateKeyRequest
histogram.summary: generateKeyRequest result using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.KeyAdded
histogram.summary: KeyAdded event count using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.KeyError
histogram.summary: KeyError event count using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.addKey
histogram.summary: addKey result using the Widevine key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.cancelKeyRequest
histogram.summary: cancelKeyRequest result using the Widevine key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.DecryptError
histogram.summary: Decryption error event count using the Widevine key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.generateKeyRequest
histogram.summary: generateKeyRequest result using the Widevine key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.KeyAdded
histogram.summary: KeyAdded event count using the Widevine key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.KeyError

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioBitsPerChannel
histogram.summary: Bits per channel of the hardware audio device which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioChannelCount
histogram.summary: Channel count of the hardware audio device which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Channel layout of the hardware audio device which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Samples per second of the hardware audio device which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoderPictureCount
histogram.summary: Number of PictureBuffers/textures requested per hardware decoder creation. This value varies by platform and video. A user visible video may trigger multiple decoder creations (sometimes every 5 seconds) but would normally not hold more than 2 sets of buffers at any given time in memory.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoderPictureHeight
histogram.summary: Vertical video resolution rounded to the nearest bucket. (Corresponds roughly to the number in 720p.)

histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from HTML5 media pipeline creation to playing event.

histogram.name: Media.TotalMBytes

histogram.name: Media.UncacheableReason
histogram.summary: Reasons a media response won't be used to satisfy a future request.

histogram.name: Media.URLScheme

histogram.name: Media.VAVDAH264.DecoderFailure
histogram.summary: Error codes reported by video decode using VA-API hardware video decoder.

histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: Memory.Browser
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.CachedFontAndDC
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: Memory.Chrome
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each chrome:// renderer process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ChromeProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active chrome:// processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Extension
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each extension process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.GlyphPagesPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of glyph pages present in the renderer when it commits a load. Since this is per-sub-process, you can get the average number of glyph pages in the system by multiplying this number with the average number of renderers. Note that this typically won't count the glyph pages added as a result of the load that just committed, since layout will happen after the commit. There are 512 bytes per glyph page, but this number also very closely approximates the number of glyph width map pages in the same renderer. The only difference is that if you have font fallback, it will make a new glyph page and no width page, but in most common cases there is no fallback). Width pages are 1K each (256 floats), so you could think of this value as being the number of "1.5K units related to glyphs per renderer per page load".

histogram.name: Memory.Gpu
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the GPU process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Graphics
histogram.summary: System-wide graphics driver memory consumption. Recorded on Chrome OS for platforms where it is exposed by the kernel (for example, Intel i915 and Exynos Mali). Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.summary: The swap used by each Pepper plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.summary: The swap used by each plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.summary: Value of getMemoryClass() recorded once upon startup. This is an integer, device-specific constant correlated with the amount of memory available on Android device.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.LowMemoryLoadedTabCount
histogram.summary: Number of loaded (memory-resident) tabs when LowMemory notification is delivered.

histogram.name: Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Changed

histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting.

histogram.name: Mouse.Sensitivity.Started
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Started.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.PreTapEventsFollowedByClick

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.TapUnconfirmeds

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameScheme
