histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to its first layout.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToStart
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it starts loading.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFinish
histogram.summary: The time from when a page started loading to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: The time from when a page starts loading to when the main document is finished loading.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: The time from when a page starts loading to its first layout.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Abandoned
histogram.summary: Distribution of actual finished pages, vs abandoned pages, where we needed to declare a finish time prematurely since the page was being closed (exited).

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelContentPaintDurationMS
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect non-root layers.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelContentPaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect non-root layers.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelDoDeferredUpdateDelay
histogram.summary: Time between frames when GPU acceleration is active.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelRootPaintDurationMS
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect the root layer.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelRootPaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect the root layer.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AnimationCallbackDelayTime
histogram.summary: Time from when the animation callback was posted to when it ran.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToCommit
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "commit." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFinish
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "first paint." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.summary: Time from "big" to "first paint after load." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish doc." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish doc" == main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint after load." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CompositorThreadImplDrawDelay
histogram.summary: Time between frames, as measured on the compositor thread. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountCulled
histogram.summary: Number of pixels that culling prevented being drawn to the screen, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountOpaque
histogram.summary: Number of pixels drawn to the screen and known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountTranslucent
histogram.summary: Number of pixels drawn to the screen and not known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "finish doc" to "finish." "Finish doc"== main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.FinishToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.summary: Time from "finish " to "first paint after load." "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LanguageDetection
histogram.summary: Time to determine the page language. This is done after the page has been loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LCDText.PercentageOfAALayers
histogram.summary: The ratio of LCDText CC Layers / candidate LCDText layers. Recorded in LayerTreeHost, after LayerTreeHostCommon::CalculateDrawProperties() has computed the properties we need. Only recorded for the first 50 frames of every page.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LCDText.PercentageOfCandidateLayers
histogram.summary: The ratio of CC Layers which are candidates for LCDText AA / total picture or content Layers. Recorded in LayerTreeHost, after LayerTreeHostCommon::CalculateDrawProperties() has computed the properties we need. Only recorded for the first 50 frames of every page.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LoadType
histogram.summary: Probability distribution for enumerated varieties of page loads.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountCulled_Draw
histogram.summary: Number of pixels that culling prevented being drawn to the screen, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountOpaque
histogram.summary: Number of pixels known to be opaque, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountPainted
histogram.summary: Number of pixels painted by WebKit into main memory, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountTranslucent
histogram.summary: Number of pixels not known to be opaque opaque, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover.

histogram.name: Renderer4.renderPassCount
histogram.summary: The number of render passes (or render targets) in the renderer's frame. If the value is more than one, then an intermediate rendering target must be used during the rendering of the frame for each render pass greater than one.

histogram.name: Renderer4.RequestToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "finish." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.RequestToStart
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "start." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Snapshot
histogram.summary: Time to capture a renderer snapshot.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwareDoDeferredUpdateDelay
histogram.summary: Time between frames when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwarePaintDurationMS
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwarePaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.StartToCommit
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "commit." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.StartToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "finish." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.TextureGpuUploadTimeUS
histogram.summary: The number of microseconds it took to upload a tile's full texture as measured on the GPU process.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Thumbnail
histogram.summary: Time to capture a renderer thumbnail.

histogram.name: Renderer4.tileCountCulled_Upload
histogram.summary: Number of tiles that culling prevented being uploaded to texture memory. This is an approximation and is recorded as a 100 times the percentage of the number of tiles, of default size, needed to cover the viewport. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountCulled
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2012, replaced with Renderer4.tileCountCulled_Upload.
histogram.summary: Number of pixels that culling prevented being uploaded to texture memory, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountOpaque
histogram.summary: Number of pixels uploaded to texture memory and known to be opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountTranslucent
histogram.summary: Number of pixels uploaded to texture memory and not known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.DismissalState
histogram.summary: The state of the requestAutocomplete() dialog when it was dismissed.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.InitialUserState
histogram.summary: The initial state of a user that's interacting with a freshly shown requestAutocomplete() dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.PopupInDialog
histogram.summary: User interactions with the Autofill popup shown while filling an requestAutocomplete() dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.Security
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of security warnings and errors in the RequestAutocomplete dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration.Cancel
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up canceling out of the dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration.Submit
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up accepting the dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiEvents
histogram.summary: Measures how users are interacting with the requestAutocomplete() dialog UI.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiLatencyToShow
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of time it takes for the requestAutocomplete() UI to be actionable by the user after it is shown.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.WalletErrors
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of errors in communicating with the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.WalletRequiredActions
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of required user actions returned by the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: SB.BloomFilter
histogram.summary: The first stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our in-memory bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB.BuildBloom
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: SB.Database
histogram.summary: The second stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our SQLite database.

histogram.name: SB.DBCheck
histogram.summary: The second stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our SQLite database. This time includes the filter check time.

histogram.name: SB.Delay
histogram.summary: This measures the time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB.FilterCheck
histogram.summary: The first stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our in-memory hash table.

histogram.name: SB.Network
histogram.summary: The third and final stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to get a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a particular URL.

histogram.name: SB.NetworkCheck
histogram.summary: The third and final stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to get a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a particular URL. This time includes the filter and database check time.

histogram.name: SB.PauseSafe
histogram.summary: This measures the time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB.Update
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: SB2.AddPrefixes
histogram.summary: The number of add prefixes stored in the database after the last update.

histogram.name: SB2.BloomFailure
histogram.summary: Track failures when in processing the safe-browsing database bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB2.BloomFilterFalsePositives
histogram.summary: All prefix misses (server returned no full hashes) and prefix misses due to false positives in the bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB2.BloomFilterLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load the BloomFilter file.

histogram.name: SB2.BrowseDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the browsing SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildFilter
histogram.summary: The time that it took to regenerate the filter after we have received all the update chunks.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadBytes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.BuildReadKilobytes.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes read by the browser process during the bloom filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadKilobytes
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes read by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadOperations
histogram.summary: The number of read operations issued by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteBytes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.BuildWriteKilobytes.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes written by the browser process during the bloom filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteKilobytes
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes written by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteOperations
histogram.summary: The number of write operations issued by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkInsert
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to write one redirect URL (which can contain multiple chunks) to the database.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkRequest
histogram.summary: The network time between the request and response for a chunk.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkSize
histogram.summary: The size of one chunk URL.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseBytes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.DatabaseKilobytes.
histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database file on disk.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseFailure
histogram.summary: Track failures when updating the safe-browsing database.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseOpen
histogram.summary: The time it takes to initialize the SafeBrowsing storage backend, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseUpdateKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the update file before merging with the database file, in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.Delay
histogram.summary: The time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadChecks
histogram.summary: Records results of SafeBrowsing download check, including both url check and downloaded file hash check.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the downloads SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a download to finish.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadHashCheckDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for SafeBrowsing to check hash of a download file.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadUrlCheckDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for SafeBrowsing to check a download url.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadUrlChecks
histogram.summary: Records results of SafeBrowsing download url check.

histogram.name: SB2.FailedUpdate
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times an update failed when being committed to the database.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterCheck
histogram.summary: The time that it took to check a URL against our in-memory filter.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the current bloom filter in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterLoad
histogram.summary: Which filter file the database loaded from disk.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterMissing
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times we attempted to load the bloom filter file but it was missing.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterReadFail
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times we attempted to load the bloom filter file but failed while reading the file on disk.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterSize
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.FilterKilobytes.
histogram.summary: The size of the current bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterWriteFail
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times we attempted to save the bloom filter file but failed while writing the file to disk.

histogram.name: SB2.FormatEvent
histogram.summary: Tracks events involved in upgrading safe-browsing data from SQLite format to new file format.

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash200
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_200.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned data (valid requests).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash204
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_204.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned empty data (false positives).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResult
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash requests to server (STATUS_200 and STATUS_204), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus those 200 responses corrosponding to items deleted on the server but not yet deleted on the client. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResultDownload
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash requests to server (STATUS_200 and STATUS_204), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus those 200 responses corrosponding to items deleted on the server but not yet deleted on the client. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashServerMiss
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult FULL_HASH_* and SB2.BloomFilterFalsePositives. It is unclear if this histogram ever reported useful data.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests returning full hashes that didn't match the URL that initiated the request.

histogram.name: SB2.HandleCorrupt
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times a database was found corrupt and reset.

histogram.name: SB2.InterstitialAction
histogram.summary: Track number of times Safe Browsing interstitials have been shown, and how many times they have been clicked through or not.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeDiagnostic
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on diagnostic page link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more about malware link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimePrivacyPolicy
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the privacy policy link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.Network
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a GetHash request.

histogram.name: SB2.OldDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: Size of v1 database deleted from client profile.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeReportError
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the report error link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetBitsPerPrefix
histogram.summary: The size of the PrefixSet storage in bits, divided by the number of prefixes represented. Should almost always be 16.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetEvent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 9/2012. No longer generated, BloomFilter being removed.
histogram.summary: Records how well the PrefixSet implementation matches the BloomFilter implementation.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the PrefixSet file in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load the PrefixSet file.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredExcess
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How many extra results GetPrefixes returns.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredShortfall
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How many fewer results GetPrefixes returns.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDelta
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How far unsorted deltas are from expected value.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDifference
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. Distance of unsorted elements from expected location.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedPercent
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How far into the results unsorted elements were found. Interesting values would be 0%, 50%, or 100%.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedSize
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. Size of unsorted sets. To see if there is a problem with a particular size of dataset.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetWrite
histogram.summary: Time to store the PrefixSet file.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the Side Effect Free Whitelist SaafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file in kilobytes, after an udpate has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetWrite
histogram.summary: Time to store the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistStatus
histogram.summary: The instantiation status of the SideEffectFreeWhitelist.

histogram.name: SB2.SubPrefixes
histogram.summary: The number of sub prefixes stored in the database after the last update.

histogram.name: SB2.Update
histogram.summary: The time from the receipt of the update request to the receipt of the final update chunk.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateRequestSize
histogram.summary: The payload size of update requests to the server.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateResult
histogram.summary: Result from trying to update the SafeBrowsing data.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateSize
histogram.summary: The size of all the chunk URLs in an update response.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateUrls
histogram.summary: The number of chunk URLs in an update response.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.CheckDownloadStats
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of the reason why downloads are marked as being malicious or clean by the improved SafeBrowsing binary download protection.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadExtensions
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of how often users download a file with a file extension that is possibly dangerous (e.g., exe, class).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestDuration
histogram.summary: Records the total time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to check whether the content of a download is malicious or not. This histogram only includes requests that are sent to the SafeBrowsing server.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetError
histogram.summary: The net error code for all CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of the upload data for CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestResponseCode
histogram.summary: For CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers with successful status, the HTTP response code that was received.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedBinaryDownload
histogram.summary: Records the number of signed vs. unsigned executables that are downloaded.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedOrWhitelistedDownload
histogram.summary: Counter which is incremented whenever an executable is downloaded which is either signed or whose URL matches the download whitelist.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.SentReports
histogram.summary: Measures the success rate of sending malware reports. Sending a report can fail due to a client reaching the limit on the number of reports it can send per day or due to the report failing to be serialized.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CancelClassificationReason
histogram.summary: The counts for various reasons why an in-progress phishing classification was canceled.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CheckNoPendingClassificationFailed
histogram.summary: The number of times client-side phishing classifier expected to have no pending classifications running but that check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClassificationStart
histogram.summary: The number of pages that we could have possibly classified (essentially the number of top page navigations by users with SBClientPhishing enabled). The name is slightly misleading as it is recorded before "Preclassification" happens.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientModelStatus
histogram.summary: The counts for various model status codes that we get after loading a new client-side phishing model.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureChunkTime
histogram.summary: The time that an individual chunk of DOM feature extraction work took.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureFrameRemoved
histogram.summary: The number of times that DOM feature extraction finished early because the active WebDocument's frame was removed during traversal.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureIterations
histogram.summary: The number of iterations that the DOM feature extractor took to finish.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureResumeTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took to resume DOM feature extraction for the phishing classifier. Longer times may indicate that the page DOM changed between chunks of work and the extractor had to re-traverse up to the saved position.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureTimeout
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were aborted because DOM feature extraction took too long.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureTotalTime
histogram.summary: The time that the DOM feature extarctor took to finish, summed across all chunks of work.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.GrabPhishingThumbnail
histogram.summary: Time spent generating the thumbnail.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.IllegalFeatureValue
histogram.summary: The number of features which were omitted from phishing classification because they were added with an illegal value. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InitPrivateNetworksFailed
histogram.summary: The number of times that the phishing detection service could not be initialized due to an error parsing the private IP networks. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InvalidWhitelistExpression
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. Whitelist entries are no longer part of ClientPhishingResponse.
histogram.summary: The number of whitelist_expression entries in a ClientPhishingResponse that could not be canonicalized.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PreClassificationCheckFail
histogram.summary: Records the number of phishing classifications that were skipped because a pre-classification check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ReportLimitSkipped
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were previously cached as being phishing but that will get re-classified (to possibly fix false positives).

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestNotSerialized
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifier pingbacks that were skipped because serializing the request protocol buffer to string failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestSatisfiedFromCache
histogram.summary: The number of times that a cached phishing classification result was used, rather than pinging the server.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ScorerCreationStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status when we create a scorer object for the client-side phishing detection classifier.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureBreakIterError
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were aborted because the term feature extractor failed to initialize an ICU break iterator.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureChunkTime
histogram.summary: The time that an individual chunk of term feature extraction work took.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureIterations
histogram.summary: The number of iterations that the term feature extractor took to finish.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureTimeout
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classification that were aborted because term feature extraction took too long.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureTotalTime
histogram.summary: The time that the term feature extarctor took to finish, summed across all chunks of work.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TooManyFeatures
histogram.summary: The number of times that the limit on the number of phishing classifier features for a page was reached. This may indicate a bug, or that kMaxFeatureSize is too small.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.URLFeatureTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract URL features for the phishing classifier.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Activations
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback has been started, broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.ActiveFeedbacks
histogram.summary: When a new download feedback request is added, records the number of download requests currently active and/or pending.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Shown
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback button has been shown, broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeEligibleKB
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that were of the correct danger type, regardless if they meet the max file size check or if they are actually uploaded or not.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeFailure
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that failed to be uploaded to the feedback service.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeSuccess
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that were successfully uploaded to the feedback service.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.UploadResult
histogram.summary: Final result of attempt to upload binary to download feedback service.

histogram.name: Search.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.summary: The id of the default search engine that is loaded after Chrome startup. See src/chrome/browser/search_engines/prepopulate_engines.json for more info.

histogram.name: Settings.GivenShowHomeButton_HomePageIsNewTabPage
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home page user preference is set to the default NTP value when a profile is loaded. This is only logged if the home button is shown.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home page user preference is set to the default NTP value when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The value of the home-page-is-new-tab-page pref when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The value of the home-page-is-new-tab-page pref when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home button is enabled in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The enabled state of the Home button pref when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The enabled state of the Home button pref when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings
histogram.summary: The startup page settings when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The startup page setting when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The startup page setting when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadURLs
histogram.summary: The number of URLs to be loaded on startup when a profile is loaded, if the startup page setting is set to load URLs.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.CheckCRCResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not the CRC was checked at the moment when the last reference to a read-only entry stream is closed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.CreationToIndex
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of the simple cache backend until the index has been loaded from disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.CreationToIndexFail
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of the simple cache backend until the index fails to load.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryCreationResult
histogram.summary: For entry creation operations that were sent to the disk, the result of creation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryCreationTime
histogram.summary: The time, in ms, spent creating a new entry on disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryOperationsPending
histogram.summary: At the time that operations are run, the number of pending operations on a particular entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.CacheSizeOnStart
histogram.summary: The size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.CacheSizeOnStart2
histogram.summary: The size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.EntryCount
histogram.summary: The number of entries to be erased in an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.MaxCacheSizeOnStart
histogram.summary: The maximum allowed size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.MaxCacheSizeOnStart2
histogram.summary: The maximum allowed size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.Result
histogram.summary: The result of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeOfEvicted
histogram.summary: The number of bytes to be erased in an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeOfEvicted2
histogram.summary: The amount of memory freed in an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeWhenDone
histogram.summary: The size of the cache after running an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeWhenDone2
histogram.summary: The size of the cache after running an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.TimeToDone
histogram.summary: Time spent completing an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.TimeToSelectEntries
histogram.summary: Time spent selecting entries for eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitHard
histogram.summary: The maximum limit of how many file descriptors a process can open. Emitted each time the browser is launched, if the limit could be retrieved. (This is the highest value we could raise the current limit to if we liked.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitSoft
histogram.summary: The current limit of how many file descriptors a process can open. Emitted each time the browser is launched, if the limit could be retrieved. (We can raise this to the maximum limit if we like, without root access.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitStatus
histogram.summary: The result of trying to get the file descriptor limit. Emitted each time the browser is launched.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.GlobalOpenEntryCount
histogram.summary: The number of open entries across all caches backed by the Simple Cache. An entry is opened whenever a caller asks to open it to read or write cache data, and remains open until the last caller asks to close it. Logged whenever an entry is opened or closed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSize
histogram.summary: The size of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are written or rewritten.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeChange
histogram.summary: How the header size has changed in a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time a write operation occurs on the header stream. (This includes the initial write, rewrites, and other writes that we couldn't classify.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeDecreaseAbsolute
histogram.summary: The absolute size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeDecreasePercentage
histogram.summary: The relative size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeIncreaseAbsolute
histogram.summary: The absolute size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeIncreasePercentage
histogram.summary: The relative size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexCorrupt
histogram.summary: For each index load, whether the index file was corrupt.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexCreatedEntryCount
histogram.summary: The number of entries in a newly created index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexEntriesLoaded
histogram.summary: Number of entries loaded from the index file on start.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexEntriesRestored
histogram.summary: Number of entries restored from disk when there was no index or the index was corrupted.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexFileStateOnLoad
histogram.summary: The state the index file is at when an attempt is made to load from it.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexInitializationWaiters
histogram.summary: At the time of index initialization, the number of enqueued jobs awaiting index initialization.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexInitializeMethod
histogram.summary: The method used to initialize the simple cache index.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent loading the index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexNumEntriesOnWrite
histogram.summary: The number of entries written to the index on a flush.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexRestoreTime
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent restoring the index file by iterating directory entries.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexStale
histogram.summary: For each index load, whether the index file was stale.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteInterval.Background
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the background.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteInterval.Foreground
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the foreground.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Background
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the background, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Foreground
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the foreground, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.KeyMatchedOnOpen
histogram.summary: For each call to OpenEntry, whether the key on disk matched the request key.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.LastClusterLossPercent
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the percentage of disk space used by the cluster loss, the unused disk space in the last 4096 byte cluster of the file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.LastClusterSize
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the number of bytes in the last 4096 byte cluster when the entry is saved to disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.OpenEntryIndexState
histogram.summary: At the time that an entry is opened, the state of that entry in the index.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.ReadIsParallelizable
histogram.summary: For each Read operation, whether it could have been issued in parallel of a previous Read operation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.ReadResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::ReadData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCheckEOFHasCrc
histogram.summary: For each EOFRecord found with a valid magic number, indicates if the record also contains a CRC.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCheckEOFResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, of checking the EOF record of a cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCloseResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, of closing a cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreatePlatformFileError
histogram.summary: The platform error reported when attempting to create a new cache entry at the synchronous layer.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreatePlatformFileError_WithIndex
histogram.summary: The platform error reported when attempting to create a new cache entry at the synchronous layer when the index has already initialized.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreatePlatformFileError_WithoutIndex
histogram.summary: The platform error reported when attempting to create a new cache entry at the synchronous layer when the index has not yet initialized.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreateResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to create a new cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreateResult_WithIndex
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to create a new cache entry when the index has already initialized.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreateResult_WithoutIndex
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to create a new cache entry when the index has not yet initialized.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenPlatformFileError
histogram.summary: The platform error reported when attempting to create a new cache entry at the synchronous layer.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenPlatformFileError_WithIndex
histogram.summary: The platform error reported when attempting to create a new cache entry at the synchronous layer when the index has already initialized.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenPlatformFileError_WithoutIndex
histogram.summary: The platform error reported when attempting to create a new cache entry at the synchronous layer when the index has not initialized.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to open a new cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenResult_WithIndex
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to open a new cache entry when the index has already initialized.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenResult_WithoutIndex
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to open a new cache entry when the index has not yet initialized.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncWriteResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, of writing to a cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.WriteDependencyType
histogram.summary: Shows whether a write operation depends on the previous operation in queue particularly in the aspect of its possibility to run in parallel.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.WriteResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::WriteData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.BrowsingInstanceCount
histogram.summary: The count of all current BrowsingInstances. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CurrentRendererProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of all renderer processes, including WebUI and extensions. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of unique sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of isolated sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Sqlite.AppCache.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the appcache db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.CloseFailure
histogram.summary: Error which prevented database close.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Cookie.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite the cookie db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.DatabaseTracker.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite the websqldb tracker db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.DomainBoundCerts.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the domain-bound certs db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.DomStorageDatabase.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the domstorage db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Error
histogram.summary: SQLite extended error codes.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Error.IOERR
histogram.summary: SQLite extended SQLITE_IOERR codes for all databases.

histogram.name: Sqlite.History.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the history db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.OpenFailure
histogram.summary: Error which prevented database open.

histogram.name: Sqlite.OpenProbeFailure
histogram.summary: Error from first read of the database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Quota.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the quota db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabase
histogram.summary: Errors attempting to Raze() database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabase2
histogram.summary: Errors on second attempt to Raze() database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabaseTruncate
histogram.summary: Errors truncating database for Raze().

histogram.name: Sqlite.SizeKB
histogram.summary: Size in kilobytes of pre-existing database at startup.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Text.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite the full text db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Thumbnail.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the thumbnail db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Version
histogram.summary: Version of pre-existing database at startup.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Web.Error
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite the web db.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime
histogram.summary: Time from browser startup to the start of the main thread's message loop.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry.FirstRun
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop on first run. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserOpenTabs
histogram.summary: Time taken to open the initial tab or to restore tabs from previous session.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserWindowDisplay
histogram.summary: Time from browser startup to the time the browser window initially becomes visible.

histogram.name: Startup.ChromeCast.TimeToDisplayVideo
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from the ChromeCast application launch to the first video frame displayed.

histogram.name: Startup.Fling.TimeToDisplayVideo
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from the Fling application launch to the first video frame displayed.

histogram.name: Startup.IsResume
histogram.summary: Whether a startup is a resume (vs a cold start).

histogram.name: Startup.MobileSessionStartAction
histogram.summary: The action requested on the application startup when called from another app or the OS.

histogram.name: Startup.MobileSessionStartFromApps
histogram.summary: The calling application (if any).

histogram.name: Startup.ShowAppListColdStart
histogram.summary: Time for a newly created browser process to reach the code that starts showing the app launcher, when started with the --show-app-list flag and with no currently running Chrome processes.

histogram.name: Startup.ShowAppListWarmStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to reach the code that starts showing the app launcher. Measured from the time a second Chrome process started, which sent its --show-app-list command line argument to the already-running process and will soon exit.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupBookmarksLoad
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load bookmarks from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupExtensionServiceInitAfterImport
histogram.summary: Time it takes to finish initialization of the extension service including loading built-in extensions. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupFinalProfileInit
histogram.summary: Time the final stages of profile initialization taking including initialization of profile keyed services. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupNSSInit
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load the NSS libraries and initialize it. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupPreferenceLoading
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load preferences from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupProfileIODataInit
histogram.summary: Time it takes to initialize the ProfileIOData object - this includes initialization of the cookie store. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSafeBrowsingGetDatabase
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load the safe browsing database from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSafeBrowsingServiceInitialize
histogram.summary: Time it takes to initialize the safe browsing service. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSessionServiceCreateTabsAndWindows
histogram.summary: Time it takes for session restore to finish initiating creation of restored tabs and windows. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.WarmStartTimeFromRemoteProcessStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to start processing the command line passed in by a second Chrome process, which just sent its command line arguments to the already-running process and will soon exit. Measured from the time the second Chrome process started.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthInvalidationRejectedTokenAgeLong
histogram.summary: Age of all auth tokens rejected by the invalidation server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthInvalidationRejectedTokenAgeShort
histogram.summary: Age of auth tokens younger than one hour that were rejected by the invalidation server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthServerRejectedTokenAgeLong
histogram.summary: Age of all auth tokens rejected by the sync server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthServerRejectedTokenAgeShort
histogram.summary: Age of auth tokens younger than one hour that were rejected by the sync server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.RefreshTokenAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether OAuth2 refresh token was available at the time when ProfileSyncService was starting backend.

histogram.name: Tab.AgeUponRestoreFromColdStart
histogram.summary: Age (time since the last display in previous sessions) of a tab being restored due to the first tab switch after the browser cold start, recorded upon such restore. When the browser is started from cold, this metric is not recorded for the foreground, automatically restored tab, so that the metric tracks only the restores triggered by direct user decision to switch tabs.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreResult
histogram.summary: When the browser restores a tab, whether the load was successful. Loads can fail for instance when there is no connectivity.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreTime
histogram.summary: Load time for a successful tab restore.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreUserPersistence
histogram.summary: When the browser restores a tab, whether the user waits for completion of the load or if the user gives up by switching to another tab or leaving Chrome.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenDisplayed
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the tab is displayed on Android, including user switching to the tab and displays of newly created tabs, such as NTP or tabs opened to handle intents.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForeground
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the user switches to it on Android. That does not include tabs being created at the time the user switches to them, such as NTP or tabs opened to handle intents.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundAge
histogram.summary: Age (in ms) when the tab was switched to foreground.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundLaunchedWithURL
histogram.summary: Each time a tab is brought to the foreground, this histogram indicates if chrome was launched without an URL (i.e., from the launcher), or with an URL (i.e., from another app).

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundMRURank
histogram.summary: Rank in MRU order (0 being first) when the tab was switched to foreground.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundNumTabs
histogram.summary: Count of all tabs when a tab is switched.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundRevisit
histogram.summary: Each time a tab is brought to the foreground, this histogram indicates if this is the first viewing of the tab since Chrome was put into foreground, or if it was a return to a tab that has already been shown in this session.

histogram.name: Tabs.ForegroundTabAgeAtStartup
histogram.summary: Age (time since the last display in previous sessions) of the foreground tab being restored on the browser cold start.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Device
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad device state.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Metrics
histogram.summary: Tracks unusual CrOS touchpad operational states (e.g. running into the noisy ground issue). This is sampled at every touchpad event.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed metric.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started metric.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed.
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started.
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting on startup.

histogram.name: Translate.AlwaysTranslateLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the always translate option was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.CaptureText
histogram.summary: The time spent capturing plain text from the DOM. This is reported by ChromeRenderViewObserver when a page is loaded completely.

histogram.name: Translate.ContentLanguage
histogram.summary: A page may provide a Content-Language HTTP header or a META tag. For each page load, measures whether the Content-Language header exists and is valid.

histogram.name: Translate.DeclineTranslate
histogram.summary: The number of times the "Nope" (don't translate) was clicked in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.DeclineTranslateCloseInfobar
histogram.summary: The number of times the translate infobar was closed without the user translating the page.

histogram.name: Translate.HtmlLang
histogram.summary: A page may provide a lang attribute in html tag. For each page load, measures whether the lang attribute exists and is valid.

histogram.name: Translate.InitiationStatus
histogram.summary: The reason why Chrome decided to perform the next action (e.g., to show infobar, to translate a page without any prompting, and so on) when Chrome Translate is ready to translate a page.

histogram.name: Translate.LanguageVerification
histogram.summary: For each page load, measures whether the provided Content-Language header matches the language determined by CLD. Beyond directly matching or mismatching the Content-Language header, CLD can complement the Content-Language. For example, suppose the Content-Language header specifies 'zh' (general Chinese), a language code that the Translate server does not support. In this case, CLD can detect a subcode like '-TW' or '-CN', resulting in language codes 'zh-TW' and 'zh-CN', which the Translate server supports. This is referred to as "complementing a language subcode".

histogram.name: Translate.LocalesOnDisabledByPrefs
histogram.summary: Logs the user locale when the Translate feature is disabled by the user. This is recorded each time a webpage is loaded and prefs for translation is checked. This allows us to investigate the correlation between the user locale and the usage rates of the Translate.

histogram.name: Translate.ModifyOriginalLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the original language in the translate infobar has been changed.

histogram.name: Translate.ModifyTargetLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the target language in the translate infobar has been changed.

histogram.name: Translate.NeverTranslateLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the never translate option was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.NeverTranslateSite
histogram.summary: The number of times the never translate site was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.PageScheme

histogram.name: Translate.ReportLanguageDetectionError

histogram.name: Translate.RevertTranslation

histogram.name: Translate.ServerReportedUnsupportedLanguage

histogram.name: Translate.ShowBeforeTranslateInfobar

histogram.name: Translate.ShowErrorInfobar
histogram.summary: Chrome Translate shows an error infobar when an error happens on translation and the infobar message depends on what kind of error happens. This metric counts how often each error message is shown.

histogram.name: Translate.SimilarLanguageMatch
histogram.summary: This metrics is logged whenever a page is loaded. The logged value is "Mathced" when the CLD-detected language differs from the page language code , and the two languages are such similar languages. In that case, Chrome ignore the CLD-determined language and instead uses the page language code. The page language code is decided by Content-Language and HTML lang attribute.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToBeReady
histogram.summary: The time from injecting scripts for Chrome Translate to being ready to perform translation.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToLoad
histogram.summary: The time from injecting scripts for Chrome Translate to the finishing loads of all depending libraries.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToTranslate
histogram.summary: The time from starting translation to the completion.

histogram.name: Translate.Translate
histogram.summary: The number of times the translate button was clicked in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.UndisplayableLanguage
histogram.summary: Logs an undisplayable language included in the language list sent by the Translate server. The Translate server sends the list each time the user runs Chrome. This metrics tells us that there is a language which UI should support but doesn't.

histogram.name: Translate.UnsupportedLanguageAtInitiation
histogram.summary: Logs an unsupported source language detected during initiation of the Translate feature. This is reported when the language detector successfully detects the language of the webpage, but the language is not supported by the translation server because it is too minor. This metric allows us to assess how important the unsupported language is for Google translate.

histogram.name: Translate.UserActionDuration
histogram.summary: The time from a page content language being determined to user requesting Chrome Translate.

histogram.name: TryScroll.SlowScroll

histogram.name: UMA.FieldTrialsEnabledBenchmarking

histogram.name: UMA.Large Rejected Log was Discarded

histogram.name: UMA.LogLoadComplete called

histogram.name: UMA.LowEntropySourceValue

histogram.name: UMA.Perf.GetData

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoCompressionRatio

histogram.name: UMA.Unacceptable_Log_Discarded
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of May, 2012 (i.e. Chrome 21+). Replaced by the UMA.UploadResponseStatus.XML and UMA.UploadResponseStatus.Protobuf histograms.
histogram.summary: The server returned a 400 code, and we discarded a log.
histogram.details: This tends to indicate that a syntax error is present in a log, such as would appear when a bogus XML tag is included, or the XML is not balanced and well structured.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadCreation

histogram.name: UMA.UploadResponseStatus.XML
histogram.summary: For each upload to the XML (v1) UMA server, log whether the upload was successful, or whether there was an error.

histogram.name: UMA.UsedResetVariationsFlag
histogram.summary: Log whether the --reset-variation-state flag was set before the low entropy source was requested.

histogram.name: UMA.XMLNodeDumpTime
histogram.summary: The time spent in converting the XML tree into a character buffer when closing a metrics log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UMA.XMLWriterDestructionTime
histogram.summary: The time spent in freeing the XML writer and tree when closing a metrics log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UserManager.LoginUserType
histogram.summary: The number of users of different types that log in to the system (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UserManager.LogoutToLoginDelay
histogram.summary: The time between one regular user logging out and a different regular user logging in (Chrome OS). Delays above thirty minutes or which span system reboots or non-regular-user logins are not reported.

histogram.name: Variations.HeaderConstructionTime
histogram.summary: How long it took to create the X-Chrome-Variations header.

histogram.name: Variations.NetworkAvailability
histogram.summary: Whether or not the network was available when requested by the VariationsService.

histogram.name: Variations.ResourceRequestsAllowed
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the VariationsService is allowed or not allowed to make a request due to the ResourceRequestAllowedNotifier.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedEmpty
histogram.summary: Records whether the variations seed in local state is empty (does not exist) on startup.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: The counts of HTTP response codes encountered by VariationsService when attempting to fetch a variations seed from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFreshness
histogram.summary: The time interval between when the Variations seed was last downloaded and when it was used.

histogram.name: Variations.ServerStudyExpiredUniformity1Percent
histogram.summary: Whether or not the 1-Percent uniformity trial from the Variations server was expired when loaded.

histogram.name: Variations.TimeSinceLastFetchAttempt
histogram.summary: The time since the previous attempt to fetch the variations seed within the same session, with 0 indicating that this is the first attempt. Recorded when a variations seed fetch is attempted by the VariationsService.

histogram.name: Variations.UniformityTrialExpired
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times we hit the code where the UMA-Uniformity-Trial-1-Percent field trial is disabled as a result of the expiration check.

histogram.name: Variations.UniformityTrialGroupNotActive
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the UMA-Uniformity-Trial-1-Percent field trial was not active and which factors contributed to it.

histogram.name: WebCore.Animation.CSSProperties
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each CSS property is animated. There is no limit on the number of times each property is counted per page view -- a property that is animated multiple times during a single page view is counted each time it animates.

histogram.name: WebCore.FeatureObserver
histogram.summary: Count of how many instances of WebCore::Page use various features. Each WebCore::Page instance has a WebCore::UseCounter instance. It records and reports feature usage (e.g. via UseCounter::count() method).

histogram.name: WebCore.FeatureObserver.CSSProperties
histogram.summary: Records usage of CSS properties used on a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view.
histogram.details:
Every time a CSS property is parsed on a page, that property is recorded as having been used. The histogram is updated with this data whenever a page is closed, or a page navigation happens. Each histogram bucket corresponds to a CSS property (eg width, border-radius). The exception is the bucket numbered '1' - this counts the number of pages that CSS properties were counted on.
These numbers give the percentage of pages that use a CSS property. For example, if the 'border-radius' histogram bucket has a count of 250, and the page count bucket (i.e. bucket number 1) has a count of 1000 - this means that 1000 pages were recorded, and border-radius was used on 25% of those pages.
Internally, each WebCore::Page has a WebCore::UseCounter instance, with booleans recording use of each CSS property - one boolean per property. Upon destruction of the WebCore::Page (e.g. by the user closing the tab), or a page navigation happening, the histogram is updated. For each boolean that is set to True, the corresponding histogram bucket for that CSS property is incremented by 1. The page count bucket (i.e. bucket number 1) is always incremented by 1 on each histogram update.

enum.int: Any connection (SSL, HTTP, SPDY, etc.)
An SSL connection

enum.name: CookieDeletionCause
enum.summary: Reason why a cookie was removed from the cookie store
enum.int: The user explicitly requested that we delete a cookie
The value of the cookie was overwritten by a new value
The cookie expiration time passed
The cookie was evicted during garbage collection (replaced by domain_evicted/global_evicted below)
The backing store had two copies of the cookie so one was removed (i.e. problems writing the backing store database)
The cookie deletion should not be recorded because it occurred, e.g., during shutdown (the fact that these values showed up in the histogram is a bug, since fixed)
The cookie was evicted during per-domain/eTLD+1 garbage collection
The cookie was evicted during whole store garbage collection.
The cookie evicted during per-domain/eTLD+1 garbage collection, and would have been evicted by the global garbage collection process (because they hadn't been accessed recently enough).
The cookie evicted during per-domain/eTLD+1 garbage collection, and would not have been evicted by global metrics as well (because they had been accessed recently enough to save).
The cookie deletion occurred because the server overwrote it with an already expired cookie (this is a common idiom for server deletions of cookies).

int.label: Error reported or Address List is not empty
Success reported but Address List is empty

enum.name: DnsProbe.SystemIsLocalhost
enum.int: 127.0.0.1 was not the only nameserver in the system DNS config.
127.0.0.1 was the only nameserver in the system DNS config.

Channel ID was enabled, but the client had an invalid system time which prevented using it.
The SSLClientSocket was created without a ServerBoundCertService.

Initiated by Save Package on Non-HTML content

fieldtrial.name: CertificateTypeBRValidity
fieldtrial.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013. This histogram only considered the leaf certificate expiry date as a proxy for whether a certificate was in-scope for the BRs, but did not consider the issuance date. As some CAs have issued long-lived certs prior to the BRs, this disproportionately reported those certs as being subject to the BRs, but non-compliant, when in reality they're not subject.
