group.name: NonPacedPacket
group.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets were sent as rapidly as possible.

group.name: PacedPacket
group.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets are sent at equal intervals. The interval is selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test.

group.name: StartPacket
group.label: Packets are sent as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked, and no data is recorded in this histogram.

group.name: Sent21
group.label: This histogram shows the number of echo responses received from the first

group.name: Sent21.AckReceivedForNthPacket
group.label: Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received an ACK for that packet.

group.name: Sent21.GotAnAck
group.label: The histogram shows if we ever got an ACK for a packet in our series of 21.

group.name: Sent21.443
group.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 443.

group.name: Sent21.6121
group.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 6121.

group.name: 443.100B.PacketDelay
group.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

group.name: 443.1200B.PacketDelay
group.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

group.name: 443.500B.PacketDelay
group.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

group.name: 6121.100B.PacketDelay
group.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

group.name: 6121.1200B.PacketDelay
group.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

group.name: 6121.500B.PacketDelay
group.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

group.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
group.label: The histogram shows the RTT for

group.name: Sent21.PacketsSent
group.label: This histogram records how many packets (out of 21 attempted) were sent to the server via UDP.

group.name: Send6.SeriesAcked
group.label: Chrome sends 6 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are responded to, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

group.name: 443.100B
group.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

group.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

group.name: NATBind.Sent2
group.label: Two packets were sent spreading over a random period, to test if the NAT dropped the binding. Afterwords, an extra (short) packet was sent with renewed NAT binding to test whether the network that was used to deliver the first packet is still connected. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least ten packets were received in the StartPacket test.

group.name: NonPacedPacket
group.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

group.name: PacedPacket
group.label: 21 Packets were sent at equal intervals, which were selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

group.name: StartPacket
group.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible, just after the client successfully sent a UMA upload. Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google.

group.name: Bind.Failure
group.label: Only when the second packet never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) and the first and the extra (short) packets arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

group.name: Bind.Success
group.label: Only when all three packets including the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

group.name: Connectivity.Failure
group.label: Only when the extra (short) packet (with renewed NAT binding) never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

group.name: Connectivity.Success
group.label: Only when the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

group.name: SendToLastRecvDelay
group.label: This histogram records the time duration (in milliseconds) between the client sending the request and the receiving of the second packet sent from the server, excluding the idle time between sendings of the first two packets. Results are only shown if the first two packets are both received.

group.name: First6.SeriesRecv
group.label: This histogram records a bit vector of the first 6 packets sent, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are received, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

group.name: Sent21
group.label: This histogram shows the number of packets received from the first

group.name: Sent21.GotAPacket
group.label: The histogram shows if we ever got at least one packet in our series of 21.

group.name: Sent21.PacketDelay
group.label: The histogram shows the average inter-arrival time between every two consecutive packets we receive in our series of 21 multiplied by 20 (so this is essentially the time duration between the first and the last received packets).

group.name: Sent21.PacketsRecv
group.label: The histogram shows how many packets we receive in our series of 21.

group.name: Sent21.RecvNthPacket
group.label: Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received that packet.

group.name: Sent21.SendToLastRecvDelay
group.label: This histogram records the time duration between the client sending the request and the receiving of the last packet sent from the server, excluding the total pacing time requested by the client. Results are only shown if at least two packets are received.

group.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
group.label: The histogram shows the RTT for the

group.name: HistoryLoad
group.label: but only for user pressing back or forward

group.name: LinkLoad
group.label: deprecated - see LinkLoadReload, LinkLoadNormal, LinkLoadStaleOk, LinkLoadCacheOnly; content initiated, commonly back to a posted page

group.name: LinkLoadCacheOnly
group.label: content initiated, commonly back to a posted page, where browser must ONLY use cache

group.name: LinkLoadNormal
group.label: content initiated, ordinary link traversal or post

group.name: LinkLoadStaleOk
group.label: content initiated, commonly forward or back where stale cached data is very acceptable

group.name: NormalLoad
group.label: but only for user entered URL or omnibox search

group.name: Reload
group.label: but only for user pressed reload

group.name: UndefLoad
group.label: should never happen... as it is only for an client-code error case which should not exist

group.name: libpepflashplayer.so
group.label: Flash player on Linux or Cros

group.name: libwidevinecdmadapter.so
group.label: Widevine CDM on Linux or Cros

group.name: ContentPrefetchPrefetchOn
group.label: prefetch is enabled but prerender is disabled.

group.name: PrerenderNoUse
group.label: prerender is enabled, but pages are not swapped in.

group.name: PrerenderMulti
group.label: prerender is enabled with multiple simultanious prerenders.

group.name: Prerender5minTTL
group.label: prerender is enabled, and the TTL is extended to 5 minutes.

group.name: Applied
group.label: change has been accepted by user

group.name: Discarded
group.label: change has been reverted by user

group.name: Restored
group.label: search provider restored by Protector before showing the bubble

group.name: Timeout
group.label: change has been ignored by user (timed out)

group.name: Fast
group.label: Fast start by skipping normal chrome.dll startup.

group.name: Fast
group.label: Fast start by skipping normal chrome.dll startup.

group.name: SSLForProxies
group.label: SSLClientSocket wrapping the TCPClient socket eventually used for connection to a proxy

group.name: SSLforHTTPSProxy
group.label: SSLClientSocket wrapping the TCPClient socket eventually used for connection to an HTTPS proxy

group.name: TCP
group.label: plain, no proxy, no SSL socket

group.name: TCPforHTTPProxy
group.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to an HTTP proxy

group.name: TCPforHTTPSProxy
group.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to an HTTPS proxy

group.name: TCPforSOCKS
group.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to a SOCKS proxy

group.name: npn_with_http
group.label: with NPN negotiated but using HTTP instead of SPDY

group.name: npn_with_spdy
group.label: with NPN negotiated and using SPDY

group.name: Disabled
group.label: Neither extra webstore link is visible

group.name: FooterLink
group.label: Link in bottom right of footer
